page.title: 20LLANDOGO AREA. CREDITS.
page.content: Llandogo is a picturesque village set on a steep hillside above the River Wye.The houses and cottages scattered on the hillside are linked by narrow walled lanes.The area is much as it was in the past,the only reminders of the busy river traffic are local place names-Botany Bay,Barb- adoes,Sloop Hotel and Trow Cottage. Only two local descendants remain _ Mrs Beard and Mr Howard Brown who is known locally as the 'Elver King' as he fished for elvers for over sixty years.As in the past the area receives many visitors throughout the year. CREDITS. The survey of this block was made by the pupils of St.Briavels Parochial Primary School and their Headmaster Mr.G.Williams and assistant teacher Mrs.R.Andrews.They wish to thank all those who helped them in their task.
